page.title: 14CIDER MAKING, A NEW TRADE
page.content: The Sherston Earl Vineyard has been in existence for about 10 years. they grow white{grapes}for{wine, apples}for {cider}and{strawberries.}The strawberries are grown for the fruit which is picked by customers , but some are made into a kind of wine. The{apples}are grown in the traditional way although the stock used is a smaller kind so that care of the bush like trees is made easier.The apples are allowed ripen naturally and to fall off the trees . They are then gathered from off of the ground.A typical crop at present is about 300 tons.The fruit is mechanically mashed and the juice pressed out.It is then allowed to ferment naturally in large plastic containers previously used to import orange juice.It is then aged in barrels previously used for rum or sherry to gain flavour.
